content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the sine squared of, open parenthesis, x over 4, close parenthesis, times, e raised to the negative x squared power " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msup></mrow></math>. It is known that <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, f of x, d x, equals 0.0223 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>0.0223</mn></mrow></math>. If a midpoint Riemann sum with two intervals of equal length is used to approximate <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, f of x, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, what is the absolute difference between the approximation and <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to pi over 2, of, f of x, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
